newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Ericsson wins SEK 2 bln Taiwan orders.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson wins SEK 2 bln Taiwan orders.

text.p: Swedish telecoms group Ericsson said on Friday it had won large GSM contracts in Taiwan worth 2 billion crowns ($260 million).

"With the award of contracts for three new GSM systems in Taiwan, valued at a total of two billion crowns, Ericsson has captured close to half of the new wireless market," the company said in a statement. ($ = 7.721 Swedish Crowns)

The company said it signed a three-year deal with operator FarEastone to provide GSM 1800 and 900 systems, initially valued at 1.5 billion crowns, and a five-year one with TransAsia for a regional GSM 900 system worth 460 million crowns.

"These contracts provide Ericsson an excellent opportunity to again demonstrate our ability to very rapidly bring large GSM networks into service in cooperation with our customers," the statement said.
